name: Multiplicative Digital Root
description:
The [multiplicative digital root](https://mathworld.wolfram.com/MultiplicativeDigitalRoot.html) is a method by which the digits of an integer are multiplied together to calculate a new value whos digits are then multiplied again to derive another value, and so on, until a single digit value is found.  

Your task is to write a function that returns the multiplicative digital root of a given integer, `x`.  You may assume that `x` is never negative.

Example derivations:
```
   10  -->  1 * 0 = 0
   49  -->  4 * 9 = 36  -->  3 * 6 = 18  -->  1 * 8 = 8
   72  -->  7 * 2 = 14  -->  1 * 4 = 4
  123  -->  1 * 2 * 3 = 6
22222  -->  2 * 2 * 2 * 2 * 2 = 32  -->  3 * 2 = 6
```
